content.description: Starts on an arete in a tree, then traverses right after the bolt and continues up edges and jugs to top. Potential for nasty swings into another boulder before and after the bolt.
content.protection: Bolted anchor at top and one directional bolt.
content.location: Just after Stoner's Cave on eponymous boulder.

content.description: Start in the sandy hueco cave on the left side of the boulder and out right onto the face/arete. Still is super mossy but is actually pretty fun
content.location: Down the hill from the stoner cave. If you go down the ravine, it will be up the hill on the left. Located on a boulder with an obvious huecoed out cave facing down hill above El Chapo.

climbs.name: El Chapo
climbs.fa: Yup? Skyler De la Corte, Dec. 2017

content.description: Start in a hueco and go up and right before breaking left onto jugs. Beware of loose holds
content.location: Down the hill from the stoner cave. Will be left of the river if you go down the wash after it drops off. Locate it by looking for a clean(ish) red and white face that has a hueco at the base (had a beer bottle in the back of it at time of writing).
